biogHist.abstract: St Mary's Home for Children was the new name given to St Mary's Mission of Hope in Halifax Street, Adelaide, in 1953. Run by the Church of England the Home's new name acknowledged that St Mary's had returned to caring for young children only. In 1968 the Home moved to a new building at Prospect. St Mary's Home for Children closed in 1990.
biogHist.p: St Mary's Home for Children was the new name given to St Mary's Mission of Hope at 222 Halifax Street, Adelaide, in 1953. Run by the Church of England the Home's new name recognised that St Mary's had returned to caring for only young children, mostly aged between two and six years. Prior to this date the Home had taken in very young children and teenagers

During the 1950s St Mary's struggled with lack of funding, overcrowding and problems with staff. The Halifax Street building had long been regarded as inadequate and discussions began in 1955 about the need to find new premises. Fortunately, in 1968 Mr EW Tucker, the son of an early member of the management committee, donated a property to St Mary's. As it was a double block with only one house on it, there was ample room for building a new Home.

In December 1968 the dilapidated Halifax Street building was closed and St Mary's Home for Children moved to a new purpose-built facility at 26 Daphne Street, Prospect. The new premises consisted of two buildings, one providing accommodation and facilities for staff and the other dormitories for up to 30 children, a playroom, dining room, kitchen, laundry and infirmary. During the 1970s the Home received government subsidies to assist with running costs and the employment of a social worker. The Home provided both residential care and day care. During 1978, 78 children lived in at the Home and another 40 attended day care.

That same year, the Anglican Child Care Services Committee was established. This body took over management of St Mary's and the other Anglican Homes for children from their independent committees. The new committee began to move residents of St Mary's into cottage care during the early 1980s.

St Mary's Home for Children closed as a residential institution in 1990. The day care centre for pre-school children continued to operate at the Daphne Street site. The former residential area of the home was used as offices for Anglicare SA.

Address - St Mary's Home for Children was situated at 26 Daphne Street, Prospect

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Church of England in Australia and Tasmania (1788 - 1981)

descriptiveNote.p: An independent board of management ran St Mary's Home for Children under the control of the Church of England in Australia and Tasmania

cpfRelation.relationEntry: St Mary's Admissions 1970s, St Mary's Home for Children

descriptiveNote.p: Held by the Anglican Archives. These individual files on children are filed alphabetically and include correspondence, reports, admission forms and other information relating to each child.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Inquiry into Children in Institutional and Other Forms of Care (1982 - 1985)

descriptiveNote.p: St Mary's Home for Children was one of the Homes visited by the committee of the Inquiry into Children in Institutional and Other Forms of Care.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Admission forms, St Mary's Home for Children (1970 - 1990)

descriptiveNote.p: Held at the Anglican Archives. This series includes several envelopes and manilla folders containing admission forms for children entering St Mary's.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Roll books, St Mary's Home for children (1963 - 1983)

descriptiveNote.p: Held by the Anglican Archives. These notebooks contain admission and discharge information.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: St Mary's Discharge and Admission, St Mary's Home for Children (1974 - 1978)

descriptiveNote.p: Held at the Anglican Archives. This orange covered notebook contains admission and discharge information for children from the Home.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Matron's reports, St Mary's Mission of Hope/St Mary's Home for Children (1941 - 1970)
Secretary's reports, St Mary's Mission of Hope/St Mary's Home for Children (1941 - 1963)

Minutes of the management committee, St Mary's Mission of Hope/St Mary's Home for Children (1936 - 1975)

descriptiveNote.p: Ragless Avenue Cottage took in residential children from St Mary's Home for Children.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Discharge forms, St Mary's Home for Children (1986 - 1990)

descriptiveNote.p: Held by the Anglican Archives. These yellow forms include the names of children discharged from the Home with dates and information regarding where they were sent.

archref.abstract: St Mary's Mission of Hope from the City Acre 515 Collection at State Library of SA. Titled ' Halifax Street' with caption: Halifax Street, north side, February 8th 1938, right side of building is 45.5 yards west of Cardwell Street and frontage is 15.5 yards

The front gate St Mary's Mission of Hope from the City Acre 515 Collection at State Library of SA. Titled ' Halifax Street' with caption: Halifax Street, north side, February 12th 1937, site of building is 48 yards west of Cardwell Street and frontage is 14.5 yards.
